Package de.hshannover.dqgui.framework

Class AbstractWindowController

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshannover.dqgui.framework.AbstractController
      • de.hshannover.dqgui.framework.AbstractWindowController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controllable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectionCompareController, PropertiesController, ReportsController
    public abstract class AbstractWindowController
extends AbstractController
    Controller that is able to be managed by the ApplicationContext that can be mapped with a Manageable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AbstractWindowController()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected ApplicationContext getContext()
      Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
      protected DialogContext getDialogContext()
      Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
      Manageable getViewType()  
      protected void keyBindRegisterHook​(javafx.collections.ObservableMap<javafx.scene.input.KeyCombination,​java.lang.Runnable> bindings)
      Register key bindings here.
      protected FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent loadComponent​(Component component)
      Load a component with no arguments and register it with the controller.
      Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
      protected FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent loadComponent​(Component component, java.lang.Object... args)
      Load a component and register it with the controller.
      Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
      void onCloseRequest()
      Will be called when a user closes the stage with other means then the controller calling unregister().
      This allows the controller to decide if it wants to close or not and not the stage.
      The default behavior redirects to unregister().
      If you modify this be sure to call unregister() at some point or the controller won't be closed properly.
      protected void registerAfterRenderHook​(java.lang.Runnable hook)
      Allows to register a after render hook which will be called after the stage has been rendered the first time.
      This method can only be called before the stage is rendered e.g in the initialize method that FXML provides.
      It exists to mitigate JavaFX render bugs.
      protected void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)  
      protected void toFront()
      Moves current stage to front of all other stages.
      protected void unloadComponent​(FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent component)
      Unload a component.
      This will call the Controllable.onDestruction() method and remove the component from being tracked.
      After calling this it will not be possible to use the AbstractComponentController.getContext() and AbstractComponentController.getDialogContext() methods anymore.
      protected void unregister()
      Call this to close the mapped stage and purge all remains of it for eternity.
      Before closing Controllable.onDestruction() will be called.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • toFront

        protected final void toFront()
        Moves current stage to front of all other stages.

      • registerAfterRenderHook

        protected final void registerAfterRenderHook​(java.lang.Runnable hook)
        Allows to register a after render hook which will be called after the stage has been rendered the first time.
        This method can only be called before the stage is rendered e.g in the initialize method that FXML provides.
        It exists to mitigate JavaFX render bugs.
        Parameters:
        hook - to register for being called after rendering.

      • loadComponent

        protected final FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent loadComponent​(Component component,
                                                                  java.lang.Object... args)
        Load a component and register it with the controller.
        Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
        Parameters:
        component - to load
        args - to give towards the components constructor
        Returns:
        loaded component
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • loadComponent

        protected final FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent loadComponent​(Component component)
        Load a component with no arguments and register it with the controller.
        Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
        Parameters:
        component - to load
        Returns:
        loaded component
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • unloadComponent

        protected final void unloadComponent​(FXMLLoadingFactory.ComponentContent component)
        Unload a component.
        This will call the Controllable.onDestruction() method and remove the component from being tracked.
        After calling this it will not be possible to use the AbstractComponentController.getContext() and AbstractComponentController.getDialogContext() methods anymore.
        Parameters:
        component - to unloaded
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • getContext

        protected final ApplicationContext getContext()
        Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
        Returns:
        current application context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • getDialogContext

        protected final DialogContext getDialogContext()
        Note: Don't call this in the constructor, call it after the controller has been loaded and linked with the FXML in the initialize() method that FXML provides.
        Returns:
        current dialog context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • setTitle

        protected final void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)
        Parameters:
        title - that the stage shall show
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the controller has not been fully loaded yet or is unloaded

      • getViewType

        public final Manageable getViewType()
        Returns:
        view type of controller

      • unregister

        protected final void unregister()
        Call this to close the mapped stage and purge all remains of it for eternity.
        Before closing Controllable.onDestruction() will be called.

      • keyBindRegisterHook

        protected void keyBindRegisterHook​(javafx.collections.ObservableMap<javafx.scene.input.KeyCombination,​java.lang.Runnable> bindings)
        Register key bindings here.
        Parameters:
        bindings - map that will be supplied to you for registration

      • onCloseRequest

        public void onCloseRequest()
        Will be called when a user closes the stage with other means then the controller calling unregister().
        This allows the controller to decide if it wants to close or not and not the stage.
        The default behavior redirects to unregister().
        If you modify this be sure to call unregister() at some point or the controller won't be closed properly.
